The claim was circulated as a screenshot: stating that fuel prices would be Rs 200 if the BJP was not in power.
The claim gained traction on social medi: with numerous Facebook posts and shares, as well as a Twitter user sharing the alleged statement.
Alt News performed a keyword search on T: Dainik Khaskar' that matched the viral text. However, the bio of this user indicated that it shares humorous and sarcastic posts, suggesting that the tweet was not authentic.
Manoj Tiwari has not issued any such sta: indicating that the claim is not authentic.
